result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nai Oo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nai Oo appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Cynas Hla sworn. Court appoints Adam Best as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Best accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, once representation is completed, until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

$500 signature bond previously set to continue. Conditions of bail as follows: 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nai Oo in court.  Attorney Connor Romensko appears as a friend of the court. Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as Karen interpreter: Len Bathin. Interpreter appears by phone.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with OAH and NLH.

Defendant's appearance waived by Commissioner.  Attorney Samuel Tabin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Karin Interpreter needed for Initial Appearance. Unable to contact interpreter.  Court administratively releases defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
